content.question: Which of the following best explains Niebuhrâ€™s sense of alarm about Soviet intentions in occupied Eastern Europe?

choices.label: He was concerned that Americans would be reluctant to risk a conflict so soon after the Second World War or see their recent allies as a threat.
He was afraid that Soviet success would encourage a socialist revolution in the United States.
He feared that a new military buildup would interfere with the reconstruction of countries devastated by the Second World War.
He wanted to prevent the United States government from enacting censorship of the press similar to the policies of the Soviet authorities in Eastern Europe.

content.answer: He was concerned that Americans would be reluctant to risk a conflict so soon after the Second World War or see their recent allies as a threat.
